<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.

<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_upgraded_connection_mark_app_closed_:
```c
void
MHD_upgraded_connection_mark_app_closed_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  /* Cache 'daemon' here to avoid data races */
  struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->worker_pool);
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */
  mhd_assert (NULL != connection->urh);
  mhd_assert (0 != (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME));

  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
  connection->urh->was_closed = true;
  connection->resuming = true;
  daemon->resuming = true;
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "r")) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to signal resume via " \
                 "inter-thread communication channel.\n"));
#endif
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no occurrences of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided code fragment. The snippet only uses standard C constructs: function definition, pointer and const, preprocessor conditionals (#if defined(...)), macros (mhd_assert, MHD_mutex_lock_chk_, MHD_itc_activate_, MHD_DLOG, _), boolean literals (true), structure member access, function calls, and adjacent string literals (the backslash + newline is just a line continuation/formatting). None of the following common compiler-specific extensions appear: __attribute__, __asm / asm, __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, computed-goto labels, or other documented vendor extensions. Note: macros used here (mhd_assert, MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_, MHD_itc_activate_, MHD_mutex_lock_chk_, MHD_DLOG, and _) could themselves expand to code that uses compiler extensions, but those expansions are not present in this fragment. To fully rule out Rule 1.2 violations you would need to inspect the definitions of those macros and any included headers; however, based solely on the shown source, there are no explicit uses of documented compiler language extensions to report.
